Posts.Content: Hi 2nd treatment today out of 23!. All okay but can i ask does your boob ache? mine aches around lymph node scar and top of boob. Thought check with you first before i speak to nurses tomorrow. Thanks coll xx
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Had my planning meeting today and i start on the 30th Oct and finish on 29th Nov. Got my tattoo, gosh it bl**dy hurt on the chest!. I have read the radio therapy tips, so thank you Love n hugs  Coll xxxx
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi frillyflower Im 47 as was called for a early mammogram, our doctors are a part of the pilot scheme selecting women from the age of 47. OMG  thanks they did i had no clue, signs or symptons at all. Listen to the doc's advice and the BCN ask as many questions as you need. They most likely heard it all before and will be able to help, reassure and guide you at all times. My hospital is brillant and send me all copies of reports that are sent to my GP after my appointments and they have explained it all to me in easy understanding language... see if your hospital does this , also helps to understand it slightly better. This online community is also fantastic not just from the support from every lovely member but using the search option at the top you can also find articles and previous discussions which might help you understand by just searching on a word, question, most likely you will find help etc. Found this valuable to questions that raise up in your mind a silly o'clock times!!! Not easy from the start but once the initial shock as eased just think each day, each treatment/op etc is one day nearer to kicking cancer ar**, 1 day nearer to the end of treatment  and ringing that bell Love and hugs Coll xx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Good morning What a dilema, i would be the same as you in thinking both ways and which way to go. (I was in same situation) 1) want op asap to get on track for treatment and each day/treatment is one more day to completion. 2) 2 weeks is not going hurt waiting i would have thought but im not medically trained. The surgeon's advice is the best i would have thought but she will be on the cautious side if you haven't healed/recovered from your 1st op. I asked my consultant if we could book holiday before my chemo starts and advised yes if in UK only in case i needed the hospital, but had to be fully healed in op areas. We decided to cancel our holiday and we have had weekends away (1-2 hours away on coast) and decided we are having the once in a life time holiday after all treatment done. If you cancel holiday make sure you get your medical paperwork for your holiday insurance. Let me know how you decide but either way, take it easy , feet up and relax Love and hugs Xxx
Posts.Title: Results following BC op

Posts.Content: Hi. Being on here is the best step you have taken. I read a lot of the posts (big help right from the begining) but dont post often. I was diagnosed 14th feb (what a way to celebrate valentines day!!!). Diagnosis was 21mm invasive lobular. I had a WLE and SNB on the 15th March. 2 out of 3 nodes tested positive and the 3rd node not defined so had a full clearance on 19th April. They all (12) came back clear but because of my ki 67 test results, i am having EC chemo (start on 8th june) then radio therapy. Listen to your body, this will help in every way. Im always on the go but this has taught me different. By being on here you find plenty of reading and helping to understand and always an ear or 2 to lean on.  The ladies/gents on here are full of help, understanding and guidance. You are never alone. Your mind goes into overdrive, only natural but it does ease but you will have moments we all do. Omg emotions go into overdrive and above, i have never cried as much (soppy over the simple things). My other half just so supportive but when soppy moment comes he just turns it around to make me laugh. Best thing to say is it wont beat you, dont live in fear as this can be treatable like lots of members have said, and just a temporary diversion on the road of life. Always here if needed Love Coll xxx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi I was diagnosed with grade 2,  21mm invasive lobular breast cancer er+ her2-. I had a WLE and SNB on 15th March. 2 nodes tested positive and 3rd no defined answereven after further testing. Consultant confirmed this one was a rogue lol. I also had a lengthy discussion with my consultant and breast team and was offered to trial and wait to see what outcome/route to take or full axillary clearance. I opted for the clearance has i wanted to cut all the little nasties chances as possible. This was done on the 19th April. I followed all the exercises from the begining and had full movement at all time. These came back clear :). But my KI 67 result means i do have to go through chemo ( start 8th June) followed by radio therapy. I will also be on tamoxifen etc for 10 years.   I have suffered with lymphodema and erythema but on anitbiotics now into 3rd week. I also have been drained 3 times (my surgeon does not put drains in), so was a bit weird from having to start with feeling under arm like rugby ball to 2nd time a melon to 3rd time an apple!!! But i felt okay to good 97% of the time. Because my body doesn't like medication i do struggle with pain relief etc but not had to take much with these ops. Taken anti immflam tablets just to help with the swelling etc. To be honest wouldn't change my decision regards the node clearance., just wasn't giving the 'little nasties or aliens" as we call them as little chance as possible. My consultant and BCN went over everything again with me and fully explained everything to my partner. But after chatting go members on here and researching (not google) i kind of already decided if tested positive what i would do. My consultant let me make the decision but agreed was the best answer. You will be fine, if you need further support the members on here or macmillan support line is so helpful. Please let us know what you decide and how you get on. Love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Results following BC op

Posts.Content: Hi Are you feeling any better? Big hugs coming your way xxx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Hi Been to hospital, had to be drained again another 300mls out. (Yuk). Warned may need draining again possibly 2 or 3 times yet. Standing appointment for a weeks time also can go after onco appointment on 24th. Xxx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Thanks Aims84 much appreciated Xxx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: XjulieX  Feel for you with the funerals. Not easy to deal with when are brains are overloaded especially if illnesses are close to ours.  Im the opposite everybody at work knows and makes me teary everytime i pop in for a visit after a hospital appointment, so many hugs and kisses!!! I work in a car dealership. I was diagnosed 14th Feb (so not rocking valentines day) had WLE and SNB 15th March. Had full node clearance on 19th April has spread to 3 nodes on the SNb test. Now appointment 24th this month with onco for discussion on chemo etc. Always here for a chat xxx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Hi Anonymous49 My sentinel node  and 2 others removed on my lumpectomy tested positive. I had my nodes cleared. Its a personal choice has the other lovely members have said. I was offered the trial and for the computer to decide on clearance or extra radiotherapy to the axilla, but i turned this down. I wanted to decide and wanted to make sure that i had chance to remove any "nasties" has i could.  My test (KI 67) came back and advised to do chemo and followed by radiotherapy. Again my consultant discussed it all with me and my partner and said she would support me with my choice. I did all my exercises and only had moderate pain but easy mangeable. My main problem but was well managed by my consultant and BCn and care team. (Moderate lymphodema and erythema). I have had to be drained 3 times but my consultant doesn't put drains in. 1st time had a rugby ball swelling (642 mls) drained. 2nd time melon size (330mls) 3rd time an apple (65mls) cleared. More discomfort than actual pain  and you dont feel them drain it until its gone down and you feel more comfortable and easier to move your arm back down your side. When i first saw my oncolgist she said  i had made the right decision and the next treatments would catch any little "rogues" that may have gone walk about. This made me content that i have done everything i can to cut down the chance of recurrence. Look after yourself and let us know how you get on Love and hugs Xxxx
Posts.Title: Results following BC op

Posts.Content: Hi anonymous49 On here you are not alone, have they said how long before op? You will be ok, and take it easy and rest and must do the exercises, this will get easier as each days goes past. There are plenty of members on here who have been through the same op's and will always have an ear to listen to you. Have you contacted the support line on here? Its not easy has this bc diagnosis mashes your head up but please dont keep it bottled up, come on here, i put radio on and sing out loud (thankful no neighbours).  I can't put up with tv on during day so have radio on mostly (find your mind wanders with songs and news etc). Take care love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Results following BC op

Posts.Content: Hi I'm struggling to sleep. So tired but cant sleep if get 1 to 2 hours thats my lot. Need a hammer to knock us out!!!! Posted on here asking for advice with aches and pains, the joint pain is agony and thats before starting treatment which can cause the side effects if joint pain. Got my onco appoitment through today, go on the 24th may. Take care and nice to chat xxx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Hi  Hugs to whoever needs one, i certainly did earlier What a crap day to say the least. My op sight the skin around now got infection and looks like ive got mega sun burn so on the anti biotics and if in 48 hours no difference have to call the BCN. Also told today my mums cousin ( Sepsis)  and another of my mums cousin (cousins sister) her husband (alzehiemers) have passed away with a few days of each other.  Life is so crap, so going to put the brave look on and attend the family gatherings and most of them dont know i have BC and not telling them yet ( they would flap as i lost my parents many years ago). Trying so hard and 99% suceeding in beating this but sometimes!!!! Sorry for the long post but just needed to scream and shout,  Hugs and apolgogies xxx COLL

Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Hi aimee Thank you.  Will just have to wait nurse said appointment would be 2 - 3 weeks here in doncaster to come through. Felt kind of rough last couple of days think arm/chest slightly refilling with fluid. Very bruised and sore. Doing my exercises but feels like tightening up. They drained the site on my last appointment (wed, they took 642 mls out!!!!)  So this added to the soreness. Trying to stay of pain relief till night time has getting headaches every day. I am very sensitive to medication. Beautiful weather but just no energy to do anything Hope everyone having a goid weekend and hugs to all xxx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Hi Sunny123 Thank you so much, just seems no matter how much i rant and shout somedays dont want to help us. I'm normally okay, i'm always the one being strong holding everything up and together. Looked like was going to be a okay week,  went into work monday morning for a few hours, great to feel the old me before the world turnside updown. Tired tuesday and today infection with my dr threatening i might end up in hospital on iv with anti biotics if the tablets don't work! So hugs appreciated and returned xxx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Good morning Julie (xjuliex) Hope you havd had a good night I think being patient is a learning curve for us all. I used to get a little annoyed if things were not done on time, but now say sod it!. I think the waiting for results etc takes ages but on the other side also dont feel feet have touched ground with apointments nearly every week until op's then waiting the 2 weeks for results. I had to wait 3 weeks fot the results on the SNB has they had to send off for clearer result. Now had to sit and wait for onco appointment (they advised 2-3weeks) to start thd ball rolling for chemo etc. This gives us time to heal but now eorried wigh tbe infection if this is going to delay getting started. My body does not like medication, so every time they had to tweak the meds to stabilise me. So i started feeling yukky last night with the anti biotics and was sat doing word searches till 3 this morning after taking anti sickness meds to help ease! So actually dreading chemo and the conversations with the onco team. I so dreading they they say no due to my history with medication but i want to try and want rid of this crap in my body. So now sat here with feet up chilling lol Love and hugs Coll xxx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Hi flossie25 Dont worry i know saying this easier than doing it. Your feet dont seem to touch the ground from diagnosis but the help you will receive from the bc clinic to this site and others are all there to help. Im now 2 weeks post surgery and due to see consultant tomoorow for results and going forward treatments. I worked up to the day before surgery so my head was totally "mashed" (my job is very full on) but as well as home have a very supportive company to work for. The best advice i can give is make notes of questions you want to ask or take someone with you, so they can listen to. Some of what is said will go over your head so more ears listening will make it easier. Big hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: Waiting time

Posts.Content: Good morning i think Well over the weekend i've lost my hair, had a cry but loads of love and laughter from my family.  My partner played sinead o'connor while he cut my hair saying we matched now hair styles and the song means a lot. My sons said i was cool (lol they are 25!) 2nd chemo this friday  Hope everyone okay Love n hugs xxx

Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Diagnosed 14th Feb with grade 2 invasive lobular breast cancer 21mm. ER+ WLE and SNB 15th March (3 nodes affected) ANC 19th April, no further spread  Lymphodema and erythema 3 weeks with antibiotics. Started chemo 21st june,   admitted into hospital 23rd june unstable temp. On IV antibiotics 24 hours then released on oral antibiotics for further 5 days. Not to bad on Se's queasy tummy for a week. Injections didnt help or the antibiotics. 2nd chemo planned FRIDAY 13th JULY  aaargh!!!!!!  Eyelashes falling out. Hair on arms gone. Started to shred on head but cant tell much at moment. Hope evesything goes has planned for everyone on the chemo train this month and the SE's stay to a minimal Love n hugs xxx Coll
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi betty mango Had my 2nd chemo today. Now queasy tummy and fuzzy head. List all my hair now. Bl**dy cold walking near fridges in shops lol. Love coll xx

Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi ali owl and Supermom dont worry im forgetting stuff all the time no wonder other half called me dizzy from day 1 we met lol. I leave post it notes all over for reminders, even at work gone so rusty with not being in all time. Also might help semi flat fizzy ginger beer or pineapple soda can help with the tummy and tastes and dry mouth. When my sons canoed all over the country we would take coca cola and leave again to go semi flat as this is brillant to settle tums when turns upside down with lord knows what in the rivers etc even in Sheffield, Doncaster lol. Its a spoken rule about coca cola in the canoeing regime. Hope this helps Love n hugs Coll xxx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi earwig o and everyone else. just catching up on the posts, been to work yesterday and today and going in for a few hours tomorrow, then away till sat nightyipee!!! glad the onco listened and helped. I only take 1 dose (6 little tablets) 1 hour before chemo and 1 anti sickness tablet. Have anti sick for after and needed occaisionally. Same on 1st and 2nd chemo sessions. Get the injections (hubby does them) for the 5 days and ache a little. Makes you wonder why different hospitals treat differently? Love n hugs to everyone. Coll xxxx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Hope everybody doing ok if not hugs when and where will be with you. Well 3rd chemo on friday coming up. Been to work a few mornings last week and doing a few this week. Been fine this chemo just hoping 3rd the same Hugs xxxx Coll
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi wombat.23 and weeblemum I will check on my pre chemo appointment what to do. Whenever i take new medication or pain relief stronger than either paracetmol my headaches turn in migraines and foggy head and these can last for several days and also start the sicky feeling. So when these happen i can only take naproxen. I can not take any morphine based medication has my body will not accept it (took a massive argument in hospital after ops that i can't take even co-codomol, this was after 1st op that they realised after being really ill with morphine (was out of it when given). So scared of chemo starting but going into pre appointment armed and ready to question, got to be honest dont think cold cap will be an option once they read my notes (advised this today by BCN). Love and hugs Coll xx

I have got my pre chemo appointment wed afternoon, before chemo on friday next week. Love and hugs Coll xxx

The actual WLE cut area is fine and just get the odd twinge and again lightish pain now and again. Its the lump and swelling on the SNB area that is worrying me.  Anybody had this? Will get checked tomorrow pm when go for results. Big hugs to everyone xxx
